data.title: GPT-4 Experiment: Book Title Scanning
data.meta_description: I decided to do an experiment with OpenAI's GPT-4. I wanted to see if I could use it to get a complete inventory of all of our books.
data.text:
I decided to do an experiment with OpenAI's GPT-4. I wanted to see if I could use it to get a complete inventory of all of our books. We have a lot, even though over the past five years we got rid of 2/3rds of them. That is, I think we still have 10 bookcases.

My experiment was going to be in three phases:

1. Take a picture of one shelf, and have GPT-4 tell me the author and title of each book. I was hopeful that this would work, but not sure, and this is the critical part. I also knew I could have it put that information into a spreadsheet for later.

2. Given a list of books by a specific author, tell me what books we don't have. Preferences to series that could be incomplete. Given its ability to search via Bing, I was confident that this part would work well.

3. Given the complete list, recommend books and authors that I might like. I know that Amazon does this, but in general I think their recommendations are very superficial. I'm hoping it would recommend an author I've never heard of but fit in well with many of the genre series I like (or Elaine likes).

The results? I couldn't even get past step 1.

With a picture of an entire shelf, it totally made up authors and book titles, even though I told it not to do so. Now, I'm too surprised, as there was a small number of pixels on target (letters).

However, when I took a close up image, it did a lot better, but still made up results. Even when I tried to correct it, it failed in annoying ways. So while it gets me to an 80% solution, I felt that it still would require too much work on my end to be practical.

Below, in numbered steps, I'll show what I asked and the results.

I think this is an experiment I'll try again in few months, especially when there is a major upgrade.

#1

Here is the prompt I entered and the response: I'm going to give you an image of two rows from my bookshelf. I would like you to scan the image and give me a list of all the books by author and title and put them in a spreadsheet that I can download. Do not make up any of the names of the books author or title. If you don't know, say so. You can also search the internet to try to figure out what they are if you can only read partial stuff. This might be too hard for your capabilities, I'm doing an experiment to see if this will work. If the text is too small, I can take more pictures and load them in separately. Do you understand and have any questions or clarifications before I upload the image?

ChatGPT

I understand your request. Please go ahead and upload the image of your bookshelf. If the text on the spines of the books is clear enough, I'll be able to identify the titles and authors for you. If the text is too small or unclear, you can indeed upload more images for a closer look. I'll do my best to identify them accurately. If there are any books I can't identify, I'll let you know. Once identified, I'll put the information into a spreadsheet for you to download.

Feel free to upload the image when you're ready!
